definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: Bank of the Volga river before the plant construction in 1950.
The Volga River and the Ural River discharge into the Caspian Sea.
sentences.chinese: 伏尔加河以及乌拉尔河都有流入里海。

sentences.english: I even spent some days on ariver boat on the Volga.
sentences.chinese: 我还在伏尔加河上的一条渔船上呆过几天。

sentences.english: But this year, fewer fish are coming into the Volga delta from the Caspian Sea to spawn.
sentences.chinese: 但今年，从里海来伏尔加河产卵的鱼群数量减少了。

sentences.english: Multiple rivers empty into the Caspian Sea, the Volga being the largest.
sentences.chinese: 有多支河流注入里海，其中最大的一条是伏尔加河。

sentences.english: Children travelling to Moscow on Volga river.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在伏尔加河上旅行。

sentences.english: A city of western Russia on the Volga River east-southeast of Moscow.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯西部城市，位于莫斯科东南偏东的伏尔加河畔。

definition: Nyeva or Neva River (through St Petersburg)
Argun River of Mongolia and Heilongjiang province, tributary of Heilongjiang River 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
Syr Darya, Central Asian river, flowing from Kyrgiz Republic through Kazakhstan to the Aral sea
Irtysh River, flowing from southwest Altai in Xinjiang through Kazakhstan and Siberia to the Arctic Ocean
Sea of Azov in southern Russia

Amu Darya, the biggest river of Central Asia, from Pamir to Aral sea, forming the boundary between Afghanistan and Tajikistan then flowing through Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan/formerly called Oxus by Greek and Western writers, and Gihon by medieval Islamic writers
Vladivostok/Ming and Qing name for Vladivostok 符拉迪沃斯托克 and the province around it
the Ural mountains in Russia, dividing Europe from Asia
